Definitions: Specifies the beginning of a code block. Each @BEGIN annotation must be paired with an @END annotation later in the same source file. A @BEGIN-@END pair can occur between other pairs to indicate nested code blocks
Specifies the end of a code block. @END must be paired with a @BEGIN annotation earlier in the same source file. A @BEGIN-@END pair can occur between other pairs to indicate nested code blocks
Specifies relevant input data elements of a code block. @IN should  appear in the code bracketed by associated @BEGIN and @END tags
Specifies a block’s parameters. It defines the values that control how the input data are processed. @PARAM should appear in the code bracketed by associated @BEGIN and @END tags
Models relevant output data elements of a code block. @OUT should appear in the code bracketed by associated @BEGIN and @END tags
Links a program variable in the script code to the scientist’s concepts

Declares the path to a resource. A URI template can be either a path to a file or a template having template variables for multiple files (or other data resource) written or read by a script in a specific code block.
Defines returned results at the conceptual level
Specifies a description to a program or a port
Specifies a path to a local file
